title: US 2024 presidential election: Trump wins South Carolina primary
summary: Donald Trump won South Carolina's Republican primary on Saturday, beating former UN Ambassador Nikki Haley in her home state and further consolidating his path to a third straight GOP nomination.

title: Despite the war, there is remarkable stability at the top in Russia
summary: Vladimir Putin's inner circle has remained unchanged, and no major defections have been recorded, including in the army and security services.

title: From Ukraine to Gaza, Western credibility challenged
summary: The liberal democracies are in a somber mood, with the US Congress blocking military aid to Ukraine, and the outcome of Israel's offensive in Gaza looking bleak. Yet it would be premature to conclude that the West is in its twilight years.

title: US and British strikes on 18 Houthi target in Yemen after surge in Red Sea attacks on ships
summary: This is the fourth time that the US and British militaries have conducted a combined operation against the Houthis since January 12. Central Command also said Saturday that a Houthi attack on a Belize-flagged ship on February 18 caused an 18-mile oil slick.

title: Chaos reigns as farmers clash with police at Paris's major agriculture fair
summary: Emmanuel Macron's arrival at the Salon de l'Agriculture in Paris on Saturday provoked an explosive reaction from angry farmers.

title: Judith Godrèche to the French film industry: 'I'm talking but I can't hear you'
summary: The French actress spoke out during the Césars ceremony on Friday evening, calling on the 'peculiar family' of French cinema to 'say out loud' what is really going on with sexual and gender-based violence in the industry.

title: Navalny's body handed over to his mother
summary: For the past week, Russian authorities had refused to give Lyudmila Navalnaya custody of her son's body.

title: Netanyahu unveils his post-war plan for Gaza
summary: The Israeli Prime Minister intends to maintain a military presence in the Gaza Strip. The Palestinian Authority rejected his plan as 'perpetuating the occupation,' while the US reiterated its rejection of a 'reoccupation' of Gaza.

title: Césars 2024: 'Anatomy of a Fall' dominates, winning six trophies including best film
summary: France's main film honors on Friday night were eclipsed by actress Judith Godrèche, who called for greater awareness of sexist and sexual violence in French cinema.

title: Eiffel Tower set to reopen on Sunday
summary: After a five-day strike meant that tourists were not able to visit the Paris landmark, a deal has been reached with unions.

title: Six Nations: Despite scrappy errors, Ireland overpowers Wales 31-7
summary: The Irish team is still on course to win the first  back-to-back Six Nations Grand Slam victories.

title: The war in Ukraine began in 2014, not two years ago
summary: The large-scale invasion launched by Vladimir Putin on February 24, 2022, is just one element of the hybrid aggression initiated by Moscow 10 years earlier.

title: United States strengthens its arsenal of sanctions against Russia
summary: Two years into the war in Ukraine, the White House has announced sanctions on 500 new Russian individuals or companies, along with 26 entities and individuals across 11 countries for aiding in circumventing earlier sanctions.

title: Stellantis CEO's compensation reaches €36.5 million for 2023
summary: In one working day, the CEO earns what an average Stellantis employee earns in a year. He is paid almost six times more than Toyota's CEO, but far less than the American heads of those top 20 global companies Stellantis aims to match.

title: India dreams of replacing China as the world's factory
summary: The country is attracting a growing share of smartphone production, but its structural weaknesses, such as poverty, are an obstacle.

title: Flaco, New York City's beloved owl, dies after striking a building
summary: The Eurasian eagle-owl became a social media star after he escaped Central Park Zoo over a year ago. His death was announced on Friday.

title: Ksenia Karelina, a Russian-American accused of high treason in Russia over a $50 donation
summary: Several Westerners are currently detained in Russia. President Vladimir Putin recently mentioned the possibility of exchanging of one these detainees for an FSB killer currently imprisoned in Germany.

title: Tunisia: Former president Moncef Marzouki sentenced to eight years in prison
summary: Marzouki, 78, Tunisia's first democratically elected head of state after the country's 2011 Arab Spring revolution, was found guilty of 'provoking disorder' and 'inciting people to arms.'

title: 'How far can we go in erasing works and artists in the name of a fair fight against sexual violence?'
summary: It's hard to come up with a nuanced answer, given the very different cases involving creators, writes Le Monde columnist Michel Guerrin.

title: The delicate art of opening up to oysters
summary: Some find these mollusks, with their gelatinous texture and powerful iodized taste, to be off-putting. To win over new gourmets, Tifenn and Jean-Noël Yvon, oyster farmers in Brittany, advise us to add some crunch by breading them.

title: EU accession negotiations: Ukraine can wait
summary: European elections in June, followed by the Hungarian Presidency of the EU Council, have led the 27 member states to postpone the opening of talks with Kyiv.

title: 'Oppenheimer' wins top prizes at 30th Screen Actors Guild Awards
summary: The SAG Awards, one of the most-telling Oscar predictors, will only add to the momentum for Oppenheimer, the lead Academy Awards nominee with 13 nods.

title: War in Ukraine: Education, an additional cog in Moscow's war machine
summary: Imitations of military parades, fancy dress uniforms and weapons for younger children: Russia's new forced school curriculum is testing children's, and their parents', loyalty.

title: 'Before I went into IT, I thought that the boys were going to be better than me, that they'd have logic that I don't have'
summary: 'First times': tales of pivotal moments around the transition to adulthood. This week, Tess, 24, describes her daily life pursuing a professional certification in computer science, where she is the only woman in both her class and company.

title: Berlinale 2024: Mati Diop's restitution documentary 'Dahomey' wins Golden Bear for Best Film
summary: Diop's taut, dreamlike film traces the 2021 journey home of 26 precious artifacts of the Dahomey kingdom to Benin from a Paris museum.

title: Six Nations: Van der Merwe's dazzling hat-trick secures Scotland's triumph over England
summary: The home team's 30-21 victory in Murrayfield on Saturday was England's fourth straight Six Nations win over England for the first time since the end of the 19th century.

title: Between heckles and clashes, Macron spends 13 hours trying to maintain peace at France's big agriculture fair
summary: Keeping his distance from the angry farmers protesting at the Salon de l'Agriculture in Paris, the French president spent a long day meeting producers and talking with unions as he defended the government's response to the farming community's demands.

title: In South Korea, a doctors' strike creates chaos in hospitals
summary: Doctors and interns are protesting against the relaxing of the strict entry requirements to medical school in an aging country suffering from a shortage of personnel. The government has had to open military hospitals to civilians.

title: Half of Western military aid to Ukraine delivered late, says defense minister
summary: 'At the moment, commitment does not constitute delivery,' Rustem Umerov said on Sunday at a forum to mark the second anniversary of the Russian invasion.

title: Sexual dropouts claim the right to abstinence: 'With my two exes, we were almost sexless for years'
summary: Is sex the glue that holds a couple together? Not for these people, who accept ups and downs in their libido and come to terms with their lack of desire. Alone or with a partner, the renunciation of carnal pleasures is a choice and, sometimes, a liberation.

title: Belarus President Lukashenko announces he will seek re-election next year
summary: Lukashenko was speaking on Sunday as polls opened in Belarus's  tightly controlled parliamentary and local elections that are set to cement his rule, despite calls for a boycott from the opposition.

title: Netanyahu, Hamas and the hostages
summary: The Israeli prime minister ordered the release of Hamas' founder in 1997, and Gaza's current ruler in 2011, but has refused to release Palestinians who support a two-state solution.

title: On board a rescue flight plane evacuating sick and wounded young Gazans to Abu Dhabi
summary: Last week, some 200 Palestinians who managed to escape from the coastal enclave flew to hospitals in the United Arab Emirates. Among them were children hurt by Israeli bombings or suffering from serious illnesses.

title: Paris 2024: Normandy hopes for an Olympic boost by hosting foreign sports delegations
summary: Cities in the northern French region will host athletes ahead of the Olympic Games. They are hoping for direct economic and promotional benefits.

title: Zelensky says Ukraine's victory 'depends on you, the Western world'
summary: The Ukrainian president also told a press conference on Sunday  that 31,000 troops had been killed in the two years of war.

title: Germany, the preferred refuge for Ukrainian exiles
summary: The country is home to more than one million Ukrainian refugees, many hoping to settle there permanently, despite the difficulties of integrating into the job market.

title: Elena Kostyuchenko, Russian journalist in exile: 'Now we can only count on ourselves'
summary: In an interview with Le Monde, the Russian journalist and opponent of the Putin regime talks about her work in Ukraine documenting the abuses committed by Russian forces and her hopes for the future of her country.

title: Six Nations: Italy holds France to 13-13 draw in frustrating match
summary: Les Bleus' performance on Sunday will do little to ease the pressure on heavily criticized coach Fabien Galthié. France is now fourth in the standings with Wales away and England at home to come.

title: Gérard Depardieu faces new sex assault complaint
summary: The French actor, 75, has been charged with rape in another case and has been accused of sexual harassment and assault by more than a dozen women. He denies the allegations.

title: In South Carolina, Donald Trump continues his winning streak in the Republican primaries
summary: After Iowa, New Hampshire and Nevada, the former president pulled off a spectacular quadruple victory, confirming his overwhelming dominance among the Republican base.
